answers.answer: Your measurements usually correlate with how many weeks you are. It's not exact though. It sometimes can measure a little smaller or bigger than what you are. but you sound just fine! Almost there huh?? =) That's so exciting.

You will be just fine and shouldn't worry about it at all.  Some women measure larger or smaller than how many weeks they are.  It depends on the original size of the woman, how much weight she's gained through pregnancy, and how big the rate of the baby is growing.  Sometimes expecting twins or having gestational diabetes can affect it though, but you didn't mention either one.  The doctor may schange your due date or your baby may come sooner though!  One can always hope:)  Good luck to you and take care...

question: ok my due date tells me i should be 34 weeks, when they measured my tummy yesterday it was 36cm. should my tummy be the same as how many weeks i am or am i wrong?
title: measured wrong?
